website_summaries.verdict: The Salomon Speedcross Vario 2 GTX is a trail running shoe with a waterproof coverage. The shoe gained both positive and negative feedback from the users. Some admired the shoe’s impressive grip and durable design; others were really disappointed with the fit and weight. Overall, the shoe performs well for others, but it also needs some improvement.
pros: According to several reviewers, the upper offered reliable waterproof coverage
Most consumers welcomed the shoe’s good-looking design
Several runners welcomed the proficient performance of the Wet Traction Contagrip outsole
Most users lauded the durability of the Salomon Speedcross Vario 2 GTX
The shoe offers a reliable level of cushioning, according to a few reviews
cons: A couple of unhappy users mentioned that the heel had a tight fit
one said he had a blister
The Speedcross Vario 2 GTX is a bit heavy, said one
According to a few, the shoe has a narrow fit in the forefoot

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. 500 mile in my first pair and still Going strong. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: theenemywithin

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: It's a quickie to say that they looked good, high quality etc, just too narrow. Quite narrow shoe anyway but toebox was painful.
customer_reviews.author: DBB

customer_reviews.title: Good trainers
customer_reviews.text: Shoes seemed too narrow at first but do break in after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Off roader

customer_reviews.title: in 4 months the shoes have been torn
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very comfortable but I have bought this 4 months ago now both left and right ones are torn. I definitely not recommend this. I have paid around £80, it is totally waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo De Vries

customer_reviews.title: Under-sized and very narrow
customer_reviews.text: Liked the spec of the Vario 2 GTX so read all the reviews I could find. A number suggested they were under-sized so bought a size 9 from Amazon (I'm an 8.5). The 9 was way too tight all over my feet so immediately replaced with a 9.5. The 9.5 was still a bit tight but foolishly I thought they would loosen after some use - they haven't. I'm looking at them now on the shoe rack and thinking, how did Salomon get it so wrong with this model and why did i think they would ever get better? Moral of the story - if they don't fit right immediately, send them back.
customer_reviews.author: tonyt

customer_reviews.title: Shoes disintegrating
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Speedcross Varios, but unfortunately they just fall off your feet after a few months of use, I haven't had a pair yet that have lasted a year, 4-6 months maximum. One pair was destroyed in a day out on the Isle of Skye.. Surely if it is a Trail shoe it should be longer lasting.. No return button on the order.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great fit but no longer waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Had these shoes for walking, tarmac and grass mainly. I have been extremely impressed with the fit, (ordered a half size up) after reading reviews. They were incredibly comfortable right out of the box, possibly the most comfortable shoes I've ever had, and waterproof until today. I'm really disappointed about that as i have only had them for 61⁄2months. I would love to get another pair but I can't justify the cost for six months use.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for the walks with the dog. Good in wet areas and for easy hiking. Fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: It's not good
customer_reviews.text: Hello I bought a speed cross in 01.11.2018 and have a problem with them. I attach pictures with the shouse. I'm waiting for a response to resolve the problem. Have a nice day!
customer_reviews.author: Degetar Nelu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shows, always buy Salomon . Just cant go wrong with them .
customer_reviews.author: Gerard Christiaans

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected from Salomon.
customer_reviews.text: Way way too small also the look better in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Mr T M O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Extra Terrestrial Footwear
customer_reviews.text: Remember to go about half a size bigger than what you usually have in the UK
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: Six months use - worn on average 3 days a week and already I have a hole appearing in the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a size 11 but it is definitely more like a 10
customer_reviews.text: The sizes run quite small. I ordered a size 11 but it is definitely more like a 10.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, really comfortable and keep feet lovely and dry. Only ran twice in them but only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit but be careful of half sizes. Small fit
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Grippy solid all terrain shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fit nice but I ordered a size up after reading reviews they give good uphill traction no slipping in these
customer_reviews.author: darren w

customer_reviews.title: Don’t last
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2.5 months then fell apart. Previous Adidas lasted 12 months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size 9 come up too small
customer_reviews.text: Look as within pics. Come up tight though, had to return
customer_reviews.author: Lee O

customer_reviews.title: Order next size up
customer_reviews.text: Order half size up otherwise they can be very snug.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Rushby

customer_reviews.title: Tight for big feets
customer_reviews.text: Very tight fit if you have wide and meaty feet it takes time to fit your feet.
customer_reviews.author: T... Ö...

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a size 9 but the fit is closer to a 7 now I have a problem trying to return them!
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Far too small ordered a size 9.5 but more like a size 7
customer_reviews.author: The one

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Too small and narrow fitting, tossed the box before I wore them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Marley

product_meta.title: SALOMON Men's Speedcross Vario 2 GTX Trail Running Shoes Waterproof
product_meta.description: The SpeedCross Vario 2 GTX shoe is the trail monster that's not afraid to go to the extremes. Based on the iconic Speedcross, the Vario uses a slightly less aggressive tread, traditional laces and a full GORE-TEX membrane for year-round, all weather comfort. Lightness: The lightweight shoe (290 to 340 g) ensures easy comfort even during long trainings. Waterproof: Waterproof Gore-Tex lining to keep your feet dry at all times . Traditional lacing system: The traditional lacing system allows you to manually tie and adjust your shoes to achieve the suitable fit. Fit management The Sensifit system cradles the foot perfectly, offering a secure and snug fit. Sole: The Wet Traction Contagrip sole is made from smooth and resistant rubber that offers exceptional traction and support for running on wet surfaces.
feature_bullets: Men's trail running shoe for long distance off-road runs in the mountains or forest
Perfect fit, Easy to slip on and off foot thanks to Quicklace lacing system, Water-resistant upper material for dry feet, No pebbles in shoes due to mesh insert and tight closure underneath ankle
Extremely light running shoe with removable OrthoLite insole made of EVA foam for cool and dry feet, Comfortable to wear, Good cushioning and anatomical foot support with EVA foam midsole
Content: 1 Pair of Salomon Speedcross Vario 2 GTX Trail Running Shoes, Material: Synthetic/Textile, Colour: Black (Phantom/Black/Monument), Size: 40
No slipping on wet, slippery or muddy mountain or forest terrain due to Premium Wet Contagrip technology: Low profile for a good performance even on uneven ground
